website_summaries.verdict: Most purchasers were happy that they were given the Inov-8 Parkclaw 275. They considered it to be an appealing running shoe because of its comfortable midsole, traction-capable outsole, and its attractive looks. And although the durability was questioned by a few consumers, it wasn’t enough to quell the goodwill of the majority.
pros: The cushioning given by the foam midsole was considered by consumers to be comfortable
Confidence when running on wet surfaces apparently went skyward because the outsole unit held onto the ground well
Runners generally liked the color schemes of the Inov-8 Parkclaw 275, stating that they were visually appealing
Water drained fast from the interior chamber when going through paths that contained puddles or streams
The toe box offered the toes more space for natural splaying, some runners commented
cons: A few testers observed the sole unit separating after only several months of use

customer_reviews.title: Bit of a thin sole, needs regular cleaning
customer_reviews.text: What do I dislike, not much the sole is a bit thin but this is expected for such a shoe. Grip works well on most terrain giving you confidence to run faster in places you normally wouldn't. Upper is a mesh like compound, so great for breathability and any water that finds it's way in. Heel is soft, flexible and holds, so with some elastic laces it makes it very easy to slip these on. Downside is the colour, sure great to be seen just requires cleaning often, unless you prefer the rough look.
customer_reviews.author: Huxley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect on and off road!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve run marathons, cross country, trail and track with pins and a plate in my ankle. I’ve always had problems with Planter and Achilles with all the big brands! With these bad boys the problems have gone! Super comfortable, great grip and suitable on and off road! Obviously there will be better trail shoes and better road shoes but these cover both really well with exceptional comfort! Highly recommend and I’ll definitely be another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Rick H

customer_reviews.title: Wide fitting - beware
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are well reviewed but unfortunately they were much too wide for my feet. I recently had my feet measured and they are "normal" width. I suggest that unless you have wide feet you should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: cyclone99

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: Got these in an offer and have no complaints. super comfortable and light yet they provide really good support. I have been using them for a mix of trail and pavement and they don't dissapoint. to the point that a few times I went with them on road runs instead of using my road shoes. Great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlar

customer_reviews.title: Great styling and fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought these without trying them for size but great fit and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr M Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: nice ride
customer_reviews.text: like the design. Comfortable to run in on the streets. The finish could be better, too many bits of glue visible give a cheaper look than it deserves
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. Spink

customer_reviews.title: Worse staying power than me
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. They look great, they feel great and they're ideal for road and trail combinations. Unfortunately, they fall apart after only 200 miles. I'm gutted as I really like them and the brand, but its a really common complaint apparently. Hoping to get a refund due to the year warranty. Have purchased a different brand now, hopefully they'll last a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: CaptainSlow337

customer_reviews.title: Been tangoed!!!
customer_reviews.text: For road running this shoe is ideal for me, very light , very comfortable and provides good support.
customer_reviews.author: Jk R.

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!!
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to compare over a period of many years, but I feel that these shoes are the best I ever had. Creates an automatic stride and has good shock absorbance. I usually buy 2 pair of shoes every year..
customer_reviews.author: Per Bjorkegren

customer_reviews.title: Great hybrid trail shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable grip on these guys, it’s more flexible than I was expecting but the fit is great for wide footed people like me. Would def buy again. They come up Feeling a touch small because they are quite a shallow fit. I had to go up half a size becauseof this but they are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Will Nash

customer_reviews.title: fantastic shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Inov8 shoes, and these didn't let me down , fantastic shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Keegan

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe but to much cushioning
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe and well made, a bit to much cushioning for my liking though.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Barber

customer_reviews.title: Top trainers.
customer_reviews.text: The best, lightest trainer I've ever owned. Loads of grip and bounce.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL REID

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of trail shoes and they are great. The first run was on mud and barely a slip. Very comfortable and spot on for size.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great light weight shoe ideal for road or off road these are my fourth pair.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant shoes. Have run both outside and in the gym and they are super comfortable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Atkin

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Up 👍
customer_reviews.text: A very good and lightweight treck shoe, which allows you perfect grabbing om anykind og sublayer, soil etc..
customer_reviews.author: Lasse Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn inov8s for a lot of years this was my first out of parkclaws and I’m smitten. They have a bit more cushioning and we’re comfortable from the off. I go a 1/2size up in this fit over the f-lites which I wear in normal shoe size. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, good fit. Great colour.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, good fit. Great colour, excellent grip and breathable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Inov8 Park Claw 275 Running Shoes - SS18
product_meta.description: Inov8 Park Claw 275 Running Shoes Run with confidence on paths and trails with Inov8's new trail running shoes. The Parkclaw 275 is the perfect shoe for runners wanting to run on paths and trails, or those looking to make a transition from road running to trail running. Standard Fit Inov8's standard fit offers a close-fitting heel that locks the shoe in position, while a wider toe box allows the toes to splay when running naturally or lifting weights. Standard fit suits those with wider feet and athletes using the product for long sessions. Synthetic/Mesh Upper The Upper of the parkclaw 275 is constructed using mesh fabric that allows air to permeate, ensuring your feet stay cool and comfortable when the temperature starts to rise. Additionally, synthetic materials work in tandem with the laces to provide you with a nice midfoot lockdown fit, keeping you tight within the shoe preventing any unwanted slipping but not tight enough that it makes you feel uncomfortable. The upper features protective and durable materials that are better suited to handling trail debris and environments. The external heel counter wraps around the rear of the shoe and provides support in the heel delivering this extra hold aids foot stability and helps a fatigued runner maintain a better gait. The durable material is added to the front of the shoe where you are more prone to stub and hit debris preventing you from ending your run short. Powerflow+ Midsole Now you can run effortlessly over any road conditions with the new powerflow+ midsole technology. Powerflow+ delivers 10% better shock absorption and 25% better energy return than standard midsoles. The midsole unit absorbs shock and impact forces, then transfers the energy that it creates to the forefoot where it can propel you off into your next step. integrated into the midsole is Inov8's very own DFB Shank which is a rock plate that protects the underfoot from sharp rocks. The Shank aligns behind the metatarsals for great
feature_bullets: Mesh and synthetic Upper - Offers enhanced flexibility and comfort on the trail whilst retaining formidable durability.
External Heel Counter - Provides support in the heel delivering better stability.
Durable Material - Added to the front of the shoe in toe area provides protection against trail debris.
Powerflow Midsole - Delivers 10% better shock absorption and 15% better energy return.
DFB Shank - Provides underfoot impact protection.
